file_content.text: We should keep moving. The satellites detect more than ships.
Iain Sarkus?
Point that thing someplace else, and I'll answer.
That's me--and I'll help you with anything you want. Just don't shoot.
I guess you must need me or the satellite system pretty bad.
I need you to get me control of the satellite system.
Both, actually.
I'd consider that fair trade for a rescue. The Empire hasn't paid me since they took over.
Don't be afraid.
That's a relief. All the men you killed were here to kill me if I tried to escape.
I'll take the satellite system, then.
I get to choose?
Let's not be hasty. If it's all the same to you, I'd like to tag along.
But if Admiral Riserre discovers you attacked this post just to get me out, he'll know the Republic's up to something.
We'll have to make a few stops first so I can cover our tracks.
If you can promise this will make a difference.
Let's not waste time.
They won't know a blaster from a bantha when I'm through.
The Republic can't afford another delay.
Make it fast.
You're the scientist.
If you say so.
It's pronounced "Hawkeye."
Good call.
I've met Admiral Riserre. I'd like to avoid doing that again.
By doing what?
I'm a Hawkeye tech. We do more than just aim satellites.
Just get me where I need to go. I'll do the rest.
I reprogrammed the droids to fire on Imperials. A little more problematic than a tech gone missing.
I've scrambled their comm channels. If the Imperials want to tell the admiral what happened, they'll have to go on foot.
Watch out--these transmitters used to keep Balmorran predators away. Now they attract them.
